questions.question: What does a red traffic light signal mean?
questions.explanation: A red light means you must stop before entering the crosswalk or intersection.

questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming road conditions and hazards.

questions.question: What does the 'Slippery When Wet' sign mean?
options: The road becomes slippery in wet conditions
There is a water body ahead
questions.correctAnswer: The road becomes slippery in wet conditions
questions.explanation: The 'Slippery When Wet' sign indicates that the road surface becomes particularly slick in wet conditions.

questions.question: What does a flashing yellow traffic light signal mean?
options: Slow down and proceed with caution
questions.correctAnswer: Slow down and proceed with caution
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light signals that you should slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: What does the 'Yield' sign mean?
options: Let all other road users go first
You have the right of way
questions.correctAnswer: Let all other road users go first
questions.explanation: A 'Yield' sign means you must let all other road users go first.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at an intersection with no stop signs, yield signs, or traffic signals?
questions.explanation: At an intersection with no signs or signals, the driver on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way when two vehicles reach an intersection at the same time?
options: The vehicle that is traveling faster
questions.explanation: When two vehicles reach an intersection at the same time, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit on an interstate highway on a clear day in Florida?
questions.explanation: In Florida, the maximum speed limit on an interstate highway on a clear day is 70 mph.

questions.question: What is the maximum speed limit in a school zone in Florida?
questions.explanation: In Florida, the maximum speed limit in a school zone is 20 mph.

questions.question: Can you park your vehicle on a sidewalk?
options: Yes, if there are no pedestrians
Yes, if the sidewalk is wide enough
Yes, if you are in a hurry
questions.explanation: Parking on a sidewalk is not allowed in Florida.

questions.question: What should you do during heavy rain or fog while driving?
options: Turn on your low beam headlights
questions.correctAnswer: Turn on your low beam headlights
questions.explanation: In heavy rain or fog, it's important to make your vehicle visible, so turn on your low beam headlights.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle starts to hydroplane?
options: Steer in the opposite direction of the skid
Ease off the accelerator and steer in the direction you want to go
questions.correctAnswer: Ease off the accelerator and steer in the direction you want to go
questions.explanation: If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, you should ease off the accelerator and steer in the direction you want to go.

questions.question: What should you do if a tire blows out while you are driving?
options: Brake hard and steer to the side of the road
Ease off the accelerator and steer straight until it is safe to pull off the road
Turn on your emergency lights and stop in the lane you are in
questions.correctAnswer: Ease off the accelerator and steer straight until it is safe to pull off the road
questions.explanation: If a tire blows out while you are driving, you should ease off the accelerator and steer straight until it is safe to pull off the road.

questions.question: What does a green arrow traffic light signal mean?
options: Go in the direction of the arrow
questions.correctAnswer: Go in the direction of the arrow
questions.explanation: A green arrow means you can make a protected turn in the direction of the arrow.

questions.question: Who has the right-of-way at a four-way stop?
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, the vehicle that arrives first has the right-of-way.
